content.definition: Endovascular placement of a self-expanding stent to treat carotid artery stenosis as an alternative to carotid endarterectomy (CEA). Requires embolic protection device (EPD) to reduce stroke risk. Indicated for high surgical risk patients, but CEA remains preferred for standard-risk symptomatic stenosis.

key_trials: CREST: CAS vs CEA, similar outcomes in combined endpoint
ACT-1: CAS noninferior to CEA in asymptomatic patients
ICSS: Higher stroke rate with CAS in symptomatic patients
CREST-2: Ongoing, intensive medical therapy vs revascularization
indications: High surgical risk (prior neck radiation, surgery, contralateral occlusion)
Hostile neck (tracheostomy, high cervical ICA lesion)
Tandem lesions requiring both carotid and intracranial intervention
contraindications: Prior severe allergic reaction to contrast

clinical_pearls: CAS has higher perioperative stroke, CEA has higher MI rate (CREST)
Age >70 associated with worse CAS outcomes
Dual antiplatelet x 30 days minimum post-stent
